Posts.EditableText: I have tried this but i only get number output and not number and name of the statatus attribute any way to get the key and value to both be shown?

Posts.HTML: i want the output box to say Int 10 but i dont want to have to set the atribute value to int 10

Posts.EditableText:
A quick search on the wiki revealed this:

[quote:2afjsw8q]The key in the dictionary is the name of the attribute. The value can be left blank, or you can set it to a format string like "Health: !".[/quote:2afjsw8q]

So, in essence you can't make Quest print the name of the attribute. You set the string in the value. You can read more on it here: [url:2afjsw8q]http://quest5.net/wiki/Status_Attributes[/url:2afjsw8q]
Posts.HTML:
A quick search on the wiki revealed this:

The key in the dictionary is the name of the attribute. The value can be left blank, or you can set it to a format string like "Health: !".



So, in essence you can't make Quest print the name of the attribute. You set the string in the value. You can read more on it here: http://quest5.net/wiki/Status_Attributes
